alert.note: Alert for Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 7:54PM CDT until May 15 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc. In southeast Oklahoma, Coal and Johnston. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 PM CDT, the public reported heavy rain and minor flooding near Fittstown in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stonewall, Bromide, Pontotoc, Fittstown and Jesse. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
